homes_hear_details: Maryland has launched HOMES and HEAR programs through the Maryland Energy Administration (MEA). The state received approximately $93 million in IRA funding for energy efficiency and electrification rebates, with programs designed to complement existing EmPOWER Maryland utility programs.

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in the Baltimore metro area, 80% AMI is approximately $78,300. In the DC suburbs (Montgomery/Prince George's), 80% AMI is approximately $99,250. Low-income households qualify for up to 100% of project costs under HOMES.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in the Baltimore metro area, 150% AMI is approximately $146,800. In the DC suburbs, 150% AMI is approximately $186,100. Moderate-income households qualify for rebates covering up to 50% of project costs.

net_metering: Maryland offers net metering for systems up to 2 MW. Excess generation is credited at the full retail rate, including all supply and delivery charges. Credits roll over monthly and annually. Virtual net metering and community solar are permitted under the Community Solar Energy Generating Systems Pilot Program.

state_tax_credits.name: Maryland Clean Energy Grants (Solar)
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV systems installed on residential properties in Maryland
state_tax_credits.details: Administered by the Maryland Energy Administration. This is a grant (not a tax credit) and is available on a first-come, first-served basis with annual funding caps. Must be installed by a licensed Maryland electrician.

state_tax_credits.name: Maryland Solar Renewable Energy Certificates (SRECs)
state_tax_credits.amount: Market-based; historically $50-$80 per SREC (1 SREC = 1 MWh)
state_tax_credits.eligible_items: Solar PV systems generating electricity in Maryland
state_tax_credits.details: Maryland's Renewable Portfolio Standard requires utilities to procure SRECs from in-state solar generation. Residential solar owners can sell SRECs on the open market or through aggregators for additional income.

state_rebate_programs.name: EmPOWER Maryland Residential Programs
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Maryland utilities (BGE, Pepco, Delmarva, SMECO, PE) under PSC oversight
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: HVAC systems, heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, appliances, lighting, home energy audits
state_rebate_programs.details: EmPOWER Maryland is the state's flagship energy efficiency program, requiring utilities to achieve specific energy savings targets. Each utility administers its own suite of rebates. Programs include Quick Home Energy Check-ups and more comprehensive offerings.

state_rebate_programs.name: Maryland Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, HVAC repair and replacement, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Administered through local community action agencies.

state_rebate_programs.name: Maryland HEAT Loan Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Maryland Energy Administration with Maryland Clean Energy Center
state_rebate_programs.amount: Low-interest loans (below market rate) up to $20,000 for energy efficiency improvements
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: HVAC systems, insulation, windows, doors, heat pumps, solar thermal, geothermal
state_rebate_programs.details: Interest rates significantly below market rates with terms up to 10 years. Available through participating credit unions and banks.

programs.name: BGE Smart Energy Savers Program
programs.eligible_items: HVAC upgrades, heat pumps, smart thermostats, insulation, air sealing, ENERGY STAR appliances, LED lighting

programs.name: BGE Quick Home Energy Check-Up
programs.amount: Free home energy assessment with instant savings measures installed at no cost
programs.eligible_items: LED bulbs, smart power strips, faucet aerators, pipe insulation, door sweeps

programs.name: Pepco Energy Savings Program
programs.eligible_items: HVAC systems, heat pumps, smart thermostats, insulation, air sealing, appliances

programs.name: Pepco Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free or low-cost assessment with instant savings measures
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive energy audit, LED lighting, smart power strips, weatherization products

programs.name: Delmarva Power Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.eligible_items: HVAC upgrades, heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, smart thermostats, water heaters
